DOC.brief_title: Intervention Enhance PrEP Uptake Adherence Community-Based Setting
DOC.detailed_description: Pre-exposure prophylaxis ( PrEP ) refers daily intermittent oral administration antiretroviral drug design protect high-risk HIV-negative individual infection . In order PrEP become effective prevention tool , three critical factor must address : ) acceptability , i.e. , individual would benefit PrEP must know willing take ; b ) adherence , i.e. , individual choose PrEP prevention strategy must take pill prescribe ; c ) implementation , i.e. , process protocol must develop allow integration PrEP delivery program real world setting way feasible , scalable , realistic . This project three specific aim : 1 ) Identifying social behavioral factor likely influence PrEP implementation , acceptance , use/adherence men sex men ( MSM ) NYC , include factor individual- , community- , organizational-levels ; 2 ) Examining social behavioral factor associated disparity access prevention care service among MSM NYC might directly impact PrEP implementation program policy ; 3 ) Evaluating intervention PrEP introduce , provide , supported part prevention package deliver community health center . The project potential exert sustain powerful influence effectiveness PrEP intervention MSM , also dissemination scalability target intervention within community-based setting manner reduces disparities access maximizes cultural competence acceptability .
DOC.criteria: Registered patient receive medical health service CallenLorde Community Health Center Male sex ( birth ) report sex men transwomen At least 18 year age HIVnegative At risk HIV acquisition Past history PrEP use currently take PrEP
